generif.text: REIC gene expression was decreased in 14 of 24 fresh non-small cell lung cancer specimens (58%) compared to that in corresponding non-cancerous tissue.
Transfection of Dkk-3 and dominant-negative LRP5 into osteosarcoma cells significantly reduces invasion capacity and cell motility.
Dkk-3/REIC functions as a suppressor for human tumor growth
Down-regulation of Dickkopf 3 in elderly schizophrenic subjects.
loss of DKK expression plays a role in development or progression of malignant melanoma
The methylation level of DKK3 protein was significantly higher and mRNA level wassignificantly lower in bladder tumor than in bladder mucosa.
Loss of Dkk-3 expression resulting in impairment of glandular structure and uncontrolled prostate epithelial cell (PrEC) proliferation, both of which are crucial for prostate cancer progression.

These data show that DKK3 and WNT4 have multiple actions on steroidogenesis in adrenocortical cells, including effects on overall steroidogenesis (aldosterone and cortisol biosynthesis) and distinct effects on steroidogenic enzyme mRNA levels.
Dkk-3 mRNA and protein are clearly present in adult human pancreatic islets.

Stable overexpression of murine Dkk-3 in B16F10 cells significantly increased microvessel density in a melanoma model. We postulate a novel function of Dkk-3 in endothelial cells as a differentiation factor involved in remodeling the tumor vasculature.

Ectopic expression of Dkk3 in lung cancer cells with Dkk3 hypermethylation induced apoptosis and inhibited TCF-4 activity as well as nuclear accumulation of beta-catenin and expression of TCF-4 targets c-Myc and cyclin D1

High DKK3 expression in benign ganglioneuromas and down-regulation of DKK3 by MYCN in neuroblastoma might contribute to the strongly different clinical behavior of both neuroblastic tumor types. MYCN expression is inversely correlated with that of DKK3.

Dkk-3 expression in normal epithelium of the prostate is lost during benign and malignant transformation and differentiation. The loss of expression is counterbalanced by upregulation of Dkk-3 expression in the blood vessels of the remodeled tissue.
REIC/Dkk-3 plays a pivotal role in the biology of human malignant glioma and suggests that REIC/Dkk-3 is a promising candidate for molecular target therapy.
Down-regulation of the Dkks associated to promoter hypermethylation appears to be frequently involved in gastrointestinal tumorigenesis.
REIC/Dkk-3 overexpression downregulates P-glycoprotein in multidrug-resistant MCF7/ADR cells and induces apoptosis in breast cancer
Aberrant methylation of the DKK3 promoter downregulates mRNA & protein expression in human breast cancer development. It may be a tumor suppressor in normal breast tissue.
both ATF3 and Smad were crucially and synergistically involved in down-regulation of Id-1, which regulated JNK phosphorylation in REIC/Dkk-3-induced apoptosis.
Dkk3 is a negative regulator of beta-catenin and its downregulation contributes to an activation of the beta-catenin signaling pathway
Epigenetic silencing of the Dkk-3 gene by promoter methylation was a common event in gastric cancer and was associated with a poor outcome in such patients.
Dkk-3 can play a role in head and neck squamous cell carcinoma (HNSCC) carcinogenesis with unknown mechanism. Allelic loss at Dkk-3 locus may also be used as a novel prognostic biomarker in HNSCC.

These results indicate that adenovirus-REIC has another arm against human cancer, an indirect host-mediated effect because of overproduction of IL-7 by mis-targeted normal human fibroblasts, in addition to its direct effect on cancer cells.
assessment of Dkk3 and AFP may be useful in the diagnosis of hepatic tumors.
Observational study of gene-disease association. (HuGE Navigator)
Elevated Dkk-3 levels are specifically associated with Alzheimer's disease (AD) and may serve as a potential non-invasive AD biomarker in plasma.
DKK-3 expression in tumor endothelium: a novel prognostic marker of pancreatic adenocarcinomas.

Data suggest that aberrant promoter methylation and decreased expression of DKK-3 and WIF-1 may be an important mechanism in hepatocellular carcinoma, and may be useful for early diagnosis and therapy of HCC.
Observational study of gene-disease association. (HuGE Navigator)
Wnt antagonist genes WIF1 and DKK3 show a very similar frequency of promoter methylation in human breast cancer, but only DKK3 methylation proves as a novel prognostic marker
Loss of DKK3 by methylation is associated with breast cancer.
DKK3 is preferentially expressed by human bulge cells, compared to differentiated hair follicle keratinocytes
Clinical trial of gene-disease association and gene-environment interaction. (HuGE Navigator)
Results indicate that DKK3 acts as an antiapoptotic molecule by decreasing the intracellular level of reactive oxygen species.
DKK3 mRNA expression was reduced in 63% (35 of 56) of tumors compared with normal ovarian samples
Observational study of gene-disease association. (HuGE Navigator)
genetic variation of DKK3 may modify severity of autosomal dominant polycystic kidney disease resulting from PKD1 mutations.
Upregulation of Dkk-3 expression in esophageal squamous cell carcinoma may contribute to tumor invasion and metastasis.

Dkk-3 protein detection using enzyme-linked immunosorbent assay as molecular markers can contribute to detection and diagnosis of gynecological cancer, especially for ovarian cancer and endometrial cancer.
This study suggests that a cause of catenin delocalization in oral cancer could be due to WNT pathway activation, by epigenetic alterations of SFRP-1, SFRP-2, SFRP-4, SFRP-5, WIF-1, DKK-3 genes
Dkk3+ megakaryocytes correlated with microvessel density in PV and PMF; Dkk3 might be involved in the pathogenesis of myeloproliferative neoplasms.
REIC/Dkk-3 may play a role in regulating the morphological process of normal tissue architecture through an autocrine and/or paracrine manner.
Analyzed the internalization of Cy3-labeled recombinant REIC/Dkk-3 protein. Among the cell lines screened, mouse induced pluripotent stem (iPS) cells showed a unique pattern of internalization.

Dkk-3 is expressed in human and mouse epidermis at the interface of upper spinous layer and granular layer. Dkk-3 expression is down-regulated in the hyperproliferative epidermis including skin cancers and non-cancerous proliferative diseases.
data demonstrate that MYCN-regulated miRNAs are able to modulate the expression of the tumor suppressor DKK3 in neuroblastoma
study demonstrates that the MYCN-induced downregulation of Dickkopf-3 (DKK3) results from direct upregulation of miR-17-92 components effecting both DKK3 mRNA stability
The REIC content was lower in supernatant from gastric carcinoma cells than that in epithelial cells

A link between REIC/Dkk- 3 and Tctex-1 may therefore be of significance for understanding the molecular functions of the proteins in ER stress signaling and the intracellular dynein motor dynamics, respectively.
Dkk-3 is required to maintain a highly dedifferentiated and consequently proliferative state in PANC-1, indicating a similar function in the Dkk-3 overexpressing subset of PDACs.
A change in Dkk-3 localization during the transformation of normal oral epithelium to SCC was clearly observed.
Results implicate Dickkopf3 as a tumor suppressor in human pancreatic cancer, through the downregulation of beta-catenin expression via the ERK-mediated pathway.
The suitability of Dkk-3 as a diagnostic biomarker for prostate cancer (PCa) in seminal plasma (SP), was investigated.
Five bladder cancer cell lines among six cell lines examined were resistant to adenovirus-Dkk-3.
REIC/Dkk-3 type-a methylation was frequently detected in a broad range of cancers and appeared to play a key role in silencing REIC/Dkk-3 type-a expression in these malignancies.
aberrant expression of REIC might play some role in growth and lymph node metastasis of gastric carcinoma by suppressing growth, migration and invasion and/or by inducing apoptosis
Study indicates that down-regulated REIC expression might play an important role in colorectal adenoma-adenocarcinoma sequence and subsequent progression.
Dkk-3 overexpression induced apoptosis in human colon cancer possibly through the mitochondrial pathway. Dkk-3 may be involved in the Wnt/beta-catenin signaling pathways in colon cancer.

Dkk3 gene expression is frequently downregulated in endometrial cancer, and is associated with poor prognostic clinicopathologic markers. Results identify a role for Dkk3 as a tumor suppressor in EC, affecting both proliferation and invasiveness.

Decreased DKK3 expression was associated with advanced International Federation of Gynecology and Obstetrics clinical stages and was predictive of lower disease-free survival in patients with cervical squamous cell carcinoma.
Tumor-specific methylation of the three-gene panel (ITIH5, DKK3, and RASSF1A) might be a valuable biomarker for the early detection of breast cancer.
These data demonstrated that Dkk-3 expression in OSCC was different than that in adenocarcinomas. Dkk-3 may possess an oncogenic function that is independent of Wnt signaling.
We developed a protocol to generate smooth muscle cells from pluripotent stem cells through a dickkopf 3 signaling pathway, useful for generating tissue-engineered vessels.
Data identifies Dkk-3 and SMAD4 as potential target genes of miR-183 in prostate cancer.
DKK3 downregulation across all MB subgroups may be due to epigenetic mechanisms, in particular, through chromatin condensation.

DKK3 gene is a potential tumor suppressor gene in thyroid cancer, and aberrant promoter methylation is an important mechanism for its downregulation, which may play a role in the tumorigenesis and aggressiveness of papillary thyroid carcinoma.

elevated Dkk-3 in the stroma of the diseased prostate presumably regulates stromal remodeling by enhancing proliferation and differentiation of stromal cells and contributing to the angiogenic switch observed in BPH and prostate cancer.

Dkk3 levels corrected to platelet count showed higher levels in polycythemia vera patients than normal controls. Elevated Dkk3c level could possibly correlate to platelet activation in polycythemia vera patients and increased Dkk3 release.
data indicates that miR-92b directly regulate cell proliferation and apoptosis by targeting DKK3 and act as prognostic factors for glioma patients
Loss of REIC expression is associated withnon-small cell lung cancer.

a decrease in Dkk1 and Dkk3 mRNA and protein levels was observed in the ccRCC tissues. The serum Dkk1 and Dkk3 levels in the patients with ccRCC were found to be significantly lower than those in the controls.
The results suggested that the lack of affinity between human DKK3 and human LRP5/6 results from: i) insertion of the 7 amino acids, and ii) P258 in human DKK3.

Findings suggest that Dkk-3 plays a role in the regulation of cell interactions during retinoic acid-induced neuronal differentiation; effect on apoptosis was also observed upon expression of the related protein Dkkl-1
Loss of DKK3 expression is associated with glioblastoma.
In the process of HCC, the abnormal activity of Wnt/b-catenin signaling may be associated with the methylation of Dkk-1 and Dkk-3.
Dkk-3 has a tumor-suppressive function and a proapoptotic effect, inducing apoptosis through mitochondrial and Fas death receptor pathways in human mucinous ovarian cancer MCAS cells.
reactivation of Dkk3 enhances the chemosensitivity to cisplatin in cisplatinresistant lung adenocarcinoma cell lines
Loss of DKK3 protein expression was significantly associated with poor survival in patients with gastric cancer and was strongly correlated with the TNM stage.
Epigenetic downregulation of DKK3 leads to docetaxel resistance in human nonsmall cell lung cancer (NSCLC) cells.
REIC/Dkk-3 is a naturally circulating serum protein, the upregulation REIC/Dkk-3 protein expression could be a promising option for cancer therapy
Suggest that DKK3 may be important in mediating invasion in esophageal adenocarcinoma.
we propose that Dickkopf-related protein-3 (Dkk-3) might be a novel Amyloid-beta (Abeta) associated protein
beta2M-mediated VEGFR-2/Akt/mTOR phosphorylation and tumor angiogenesis was significantly suppressed by over-expression of DKK-3.

Data indicate that Dickkopf-related protein 3 (DKK3) improved gemcitabine therapeutic effect through inducing apoptosis and regulating beta-catenin/epithelial-mesenchymal transition (EMT) signalling in pancreatic cancer cell.
Down-regulation of Dkk3 is associated with recurrence in Endometrioid Adenocarcinoma.
A decreased risk of lung cancer was found for the genotype combination of DKK3 and sFRP4.
Observations highlight a role for Dkk-3 in modulating TGF-beta/MMP signals in the prostate and prostate cancer.
Administration of DKK3 protein and peripheral blood mononuclear cell transplantation synergistically enhanced anticancer immunological effects against pancreatic cancer cells.
Dkk3 is upregulated in osteoarthritis and may have a protective effect on cartilage integrity by preventing proteoglycan loss and helping to restore OA-relevant signaling pathway activity.
first report documenting that DKK3 polymorphisms are not only associated with prostate cancer but also related to prostate cancer-related factors.
in situ Ad-REIC((REIC)/Dkk-3 gene) gene therapy is expected to realize a new-generation cancer vaccine via anticancer immune activation with DC and tumor antigen-specific CTL expansion.
these data suggest that downregulation of tubular beta-catenin signaling induced by Dkk-3 has a detrimental role in chronic proteinuria, partially through the increase in apoptosis.
Loss of DKK3 expression in dysplastic/advanced stage of oral submucous fibrosis may imply a high risk of progression to oral cancer.
REIC/Dkk-3 could be involved early in squamous cell carcinoma development and have inhibitory effect on the development of SCC
studies decoding the underlying molecular mechanisms of DKK3-mediated effects may help to identify novel targeted therapies for this clinically highly relevant breast cancer subtype
this study demonstrated the anti-glioma effect of Ad-SGE-REIC, which may represent a promising strategy for the treatment of malignant glioma.

This report demonstrates that GATA4 promotes oncogenesis by inhibiting miR125b-dependent suppression of DKK3 expression. This GATA4/miR125b/DKK3 axis may be a major regulator of growth, migration, invasion, and survival in hepatoma cells.

we observed Dickkopf-related protein 3 (DKK3) as a direct target of miR-25 in vitro. Upregulation of DKK3 partially attenuated the oncogenic effect of miR-25 on melanoma cells. Ectopic expression of miR-25 in melanoma cells induced beta-catenin accumulation in nuclear and inhibited TCF4 (T cell factor 4) activity, as well as the expression of c-Myc and Cyclin D1.
The data indicated that Dkk3 has a novel role in modulating macropinocytotic and autophagic pathways, a distinct function other than a Wnt antagonist.
High DKK3 expression is associated with malignant progression of oral submucous fibrosis.
dickkopf-3 (Dkk-3) is a tumor suppressor gene that is downregulated in various cancers.
Low DKK3 expression is associated with gastric cancer.
Study shows a reduced expression of DKK3 in adrenocortical carcinoma potentially contributing to adrenal dedifferentiation and/or progression of malignancy.
Study showed that DKK3 promotes cell survival during oxidative stress by suppressing XDH expression, thereby abrogating excess reactive oxygen species accumulation and subsequent apoptosis.
DKK3 is a novel and promising molecular target for keloid treatment.

DKK3 might contribute to cellular proliferation, invasion, migration, and tumor cell survival in head and neck/oral squamous cell carcinoma cells through a mechanism other than the canonical Wnt signaling pathway, which might be attributed to PI3K-Akt signaling
DKK3 altered the atherosclerotic plaque content by increasing smooth muscle cell differentiation/numbers and reducing vascular inflammation.
These findings suggested that the down-regulated REIC expression might be involved in lung carcinogenesis due to its promoter methylation
the results indicate that TNFalpha downregulates REIC/Dkk3 expression in normal skin keratinocytes.

MYCN directly binds to the DKK3 promoter but has no effect on DKK3 promoter methylation in the adult B-cell acute lymphoblastic leukaemia.low DKK3 expression level in the adult B-cell acute lymphoblastic leukaemia.

These results show that miR-25-3p has intracellular and extracellular oncogenic functions as well as clinicopathological relevance in osteosarcoma, indicating its potential as a novel diagnostic and therapeutic tool for the clinical management of this disease.
Dkk3 expression might be employed as a potential marker to indicate carcinogenesis and histogenesis, even prognosis.

These observations are consistent with a model in which the loss of Dkk-3 in prostate cancer leads to increased secretion of TGFBI and ECM-1, which have tumor-promoting and tumor-protective roles, respectively
CKAP4 has a role in esophageal cancer cell proliferation through p63 dependent DKK3 expression

Median urinary DKK3-to-creatinine concentration at baseline was significantly higher in patients with chronic kidney disease (CKD) than the general population sample (431 versus 33 pg/mg). In the CKD cohort, having a urinary DKK3-to-creatinine level >4000 pg/mg was independently and significantly associated after multiple adjustments with mean annual decline in eGFR of 7.6% over 12 months.
Dickkopf-3 (DKK3) is produced by pancreatic stellate cells and is present in most human pancreatic ductal adenocarcinoma.

Compared with control cells, head and neck squamous cell carcinoma (HNSCC) Dickkopfrelated protein 3 (DKK3) knockdown cells exhibit significantly reduced proliferation, migration and invasion, and formed significantly smaller tumor masses when subcutaneously transplanted into nude mice. DKK3 overexpression in HSC3 shDKK3 cells rescues cellular proliferation, migration and invasion.

Dickkopf-3 (DKK3) is a heat shock transcription factor 1 protein (HSF1) effector that modulates the pro-tumorigenic behaviour of cancer-associated fibroblasts (CAFs), and DKK3 orchestrates a concomitant activation of beta-catenin and YAP oncogene protein (YAP)/tafazzin protein (TAZ).
MiR-95-3p promoted the development of prostatic cancer via targeting DKK3 and activating the Wnt/beta-catenin pathway

DKK3 overexpression in human fibroblasts under defined conditions for 4 days led to a notable change in cell morphology and progenitor gene expression.DKK3 induces a vascular progenitor state in fibroblasts through MET. DKK3 mediates cell differentiation into iECs via activation of KDR under defined conditions.

our study revealed that miR-92a played a carcinogenic role in the growth of Osteosarcoma (OS) by promoting the tumorigenesis of OS cells via targeting of DKK3, thus revealing a new therapeutic target for OS.

SNHG16 was found to be upregulated whereas DKK3 was downregulated in tumor tissues compared with adjacent normal tissues. It showed that the expressions of SNHG16 and DKK3 were negatively correlated in clinical GC tissues.All these results suggested that SNHG16 promotes GC progression via regulation of DKK3 directly or indirectly.
These results suggest that DKK3 plays a role in the progression of lung adenocarcinoma by promoting cell adhesion and invasion.
Data suggest that Dickkopf 3 (DKK3) might be the target gene of miR-483-3p.
LINC00459 sponging miR-218 to elevate DKK3 inhibits proliferation and invasion in melanoma.
Serum dickkopf-3 is associated with death and vascular events after ischemic stroke: an observational study from CATIS.

one of these HtrA1 substrates, Dickkopf-related protein 3 (DKK3), was successfully used as a biomarker to demonstrate the inhibition of HtrA1 activity in patients with age-related macular degeneration (AMD) who were treated with the HtrA1-blocking Fab fragment

The emerging plasma biomarker Dickkopf-3 (DKK3) and its association with renal and cardiovascular disease in the general population.

Dickkopf-related protein 3 alters aerobic glycolysis in pancreatic cancer BxPC-3 cells, promoting CD4(+) T-cell activation and function.
lncMICAL21 sponges miR25 to regulate DKK3 expression and inhibits activation of the Wnt/betacatenin signaling pathway in breast cancer.
Dickkopf3 and betacatenin play opposite roles in the Wnt/betacatenin pathway during the abnormal subchondral bone formation of human knee osteoarthritis.
Roles of DKK3 in cellular adhesion, motility, and invasion through extracellular interaction with TGFBI.

HCV Core protein represses DKK3 expression via epigenetic silencing and activates the Wnt/beta-catenin signaling pathway during the progression of HCC.

DKK3 Promotes Oxidative Stress-Induced Fibroblast Activity.
KDM1A drives hepatoblastoma progression by activating the Wnt/beta-catenin pathway through inhibition of DKK3 transcription.
DKK3's protective role in prostate cancer is partly due to the modulation of immune-related pathways.

DKK3 promotes oxidative stress injury and fibrosis in HK-2 cells by activating NOX4 via beta-catenin/TCF4 signaling.

name: dickkopf WNT signaling pathway inhibitor 3

wikipathways.name: Regulation of Wnt-B-catenin Signaling by Small Molecule Compounds

summary: This gene encodes a protein that is a member of the dickkopf family. The secreted protein contains two cysteine rich regions and is involved in embryonic development through its interactions with the Wnt signaling pathway. The expression of this gene is decreased in a variety of cancer cell lines and it may function as a tumor suppressor gene. Alternative splicing results in multiple transcript variants encoding the same protein. [provided by RefSeq, Jul 2008].
